intro: Veratrum album var. bosniacum, commonly known as the Bosnian white hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, woodland environments and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its toxicity, it is not commonly cultivated but is of interest in botanical and pharmacological studies.
